abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the development
            policy loan "Fiscal Consolidation for Efficiency and
            Growth" to the municipality of Rio de Janeiro in Brazil
            was deemed to be highly satisfactory, with satisfactory
            performances by the Bank and the borrower. The relevance of
            the program objectives and design were rated as high. All
            but one of the results indicators were shown to be fully
            successful in achieving their targets, while one was
            partially successful. The crucial lessons learned during the
            implementation of the project were: 1) the essentiality of
            strong and effective political leadership; 2) the importance
            of political economy; and 3) the role of flexibility in
            opening up new possibilities.
